website_summaries.verdict: The Logitech Revue with Google TV is loaded with potentially game-changing functionality, but its high price, numerous caveats, and current assortment of bugs make it best-suited to early adopters--at least until promised firmware fixes become available.
pros: Revolutionary Google TV software enables potential access to virtually all online media with a powerful interface
user interface overlays over TV content from cable/satellite box
can control TV, AV receiver, and cable/satellite box with built-in IR emitters
Google search bar looks through both online and offline content
built-in Chrome browser that supports Flash and HTML5 video
streams music, videos, and photos from a connected PC or DLNA device
cons: Major content providers like Hulu, CBS, and ABC are currently blocking Google TV
user interface geared toward power users
expensive compared with simpler devices like Apple TV and Roku XDS
too many bugs with current software
significant network performance issues with our review sample
doesn't work with older, non-HD TVs

customer_reviews.title: Hard to Beat
customer_reviews.text: Once you've had a Logitech Revue, you'll be spoiled for life... or at least I am. I've never been disappointed with them, and I have 5 Revues. However, I have been disappointed with other things external to the revue that influence its performance, such as a certain cable service provider that throttles the bandwith you've paid good money for! I've was also very disappointed when I received the last 3 Revues I ordered. They were used, and supposed to be in "very good condition" but when I received them they were literally taped together with double side foam tape, and I could clearly see that they had not been stored properly. But they still work great.
customer_reviews.author: t38jett

customer_reviews.title: Priced right, functionality still improving
customer_reviews.text: After the recent price adjustment, Google TV is a much more reasonable proposition. Setup with my Comcast Cable system was easy and it does everything it is supposed to do. The interface for live TV is much more intuitive and easy than the typical cable guide. But it still can't serve as a full replacement for cable or satellite because of content limitations. Once Google is successful in negotiating content licenses from the major studios, it will be well worth 5 stars. In the meantime, with the upcoming upgrade to the OS and the expansion of apps available on the platform, it will still be a game-changing device, bringing television and computer even closer together.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Tvenstrup

customer_reviews.title: Returned. Clumsy and Kludgy
customer_reviews.text: This simply did not work with my systems. I would probably have given it a higher rating but it was obviously a bad idea from the start. A laptop keyboard for controlling a television (even one connected to the internet) would have to be designed from the ground up. This is a computer keyboard re-purposed quite clumsily. Another review by Tony. Plant Lady had nothing to do with the product. We tend to buy everything amazon on her account these days. She can tell you nothing more about this item, as she never tried it. Really I really can't tell you anything either. It was only unpacked for a couple hours and was on its way back the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loved GTV for a While, Google's Recent Removal of Flash from Native Browser has Crippled Device
customer_reviews.text: Huge fan of the Logitech Revue. Initial sales were bleak, so I was able to buy it at a prime price of <100. Unfortunately, Google is doing some strange things these days to trim their once expansive ecosystem. Recent update to GTV native Chrome browser has removed Flash support from the device. Consequently, I can no longer watch HBOGo on my unit which is a HUGE disappointment. Otherwise, still a viable device - albeit limited app potential. Google Market/Play Store still has highly limited apps available...but some of the native integration apps for streaming media from a PC through GTV are quite nice. Could be a lot better though - implementation over time seems to be short-sighted.
customer_reviews.author: J. Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our uses.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a few weeks back after we purchased a new HD television. In particular, we were looking for something that'd allow us to stream Netflix. This device was on sale for under $100 so I bought it. Out of the box, everything worked great. Netflix streaming worked perfectly and we even started using Amazon Video Streaming on it. Recently they released a new software update and we had a little trouble with it then but it has since cleared up. I love being able to browse the Internet from the TV along with all the other great features such as Pandora. The mouse/keyboard is also designed very nicely and is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in Dec 2011 when it was $99.00, worked ok gets kinda annoying when the novelty wears off, have a Roku & WD Live box also which I use most of the time. Moved the Revue in my daughters room and had to reset up seems as though their servers have been down for over a week that other people have complained about but nothing has been done and without the registration process it is a brick. Sometimes Netflix works sometimes it doesn't, apps in market are limited and sometimes they don't even work. I will never buy another Logitech product in my life (mouse, keyboard, etc.)Too bad Amazon doesn't have any negative stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C.

customer_reviews.title: Awaiting Honeycomb, but this is real cool.
customer_reviews.text: This took about 30 minutes to set up, most of it downloading updates and rebooting. This absolutely changes the way I will relate to my TV. I understand Logitech just jettisoned the product, which is too bad. The original $300 price tag was probably optimistic for a BETA level product. I am not really concerned about lack of support, as it is a solid state box, and the future will lie more with Google than the box maker. There is a TON of content beyond what I get with my FIOS (which is now much easier to sort through than with the default Verizon guide.) For $99, this was a bargain. I will be ordering a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Jan R. Klincewicz

customer_reviews.title: It takes a while to really see what this can do
customer_reviews.text: I remember reading a review before I bought this, that at 1st glance they found it mostly worthless and almost returned it, but over time they were absolutely amazed at what it can do, well ditto. Here are just a few things I do with it, then im out: watch webcasts from around the internet, surf you tube streaming all kinds of music videos etc, play HD movies purchased/rented in my digital locker at amazon, netflix, watch the latest gaming news at ign.com, pandora (a little) and more. With the new update coming, its going to get even better, its an indispensable hub of learning and entertainment for me. for $99 bucks, just phenomenal.
customer_reviews.author: awnold

customer_reviews.title: Accomplishes the Purpose
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to simply be able to stream the internet on my TV. It certainly accomplished this job. I have two issues with it though. First, there's no standby or a power-off button. So, I have to either leave it on all the time or unplug it while not in use. Second, I am unable to connect to the internet with the wi-fi and I have to manually plug in the ethernet cable. Can't figure out why. My laptop and phones catch the modem signal but this one for some reason doesn't. Will continue to troubleshoot that though. In the meantime, I'm happy that I now can finally browse the internet on my big-screen TV.
customer_reviews.author: A. Elfeki

customer_reviews.title: I love Google TV, but
customer_reviews.text: This product is a staple in my living room. I can browse the web, manage my own digital video and music files through Plex, and it provides access to the Google Play store. The problem with this product has nothing to do with Google and everything to do with Logitech. It is under powered and buggy. They have abandoned support, so if you purchase this expect no help for anyone. Google TV is the future of set top boxes, but unless you're and Android nerd, just wait for a Nexus Google TV box to be released directly from Google or view the Vizio Co-Star which is built on the ARM processor and probably has better app support.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Junk, don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This product has had issues after a couple months of use. It started having a black screen when switching the TV to the correct HDMI attachment, causing me to have to reset the device more and more frequently until now it won't display anything after the startup logo. It has downloaded and installed the original image several times but still does not work. It's a piece of junk and neither Logitech or Google seem to support this device!
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Revue absolutely ROCKS!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a ROKU for the last two years and was never really happy! A good friend turned me onto the Logitech Revue w/Google TV. The Revue is a fantastic device... easy to hook up... easy to operate. I never could understand why ROKU can't be tuned to YouTube. With Google Chrome, I can lie in bed and surf to my heart's content. I've been gung ho for Logitech, since I bought my first wireless keyboard and mouse. Logitech RULES and I can't say enuf about them. Get a revue, you won't regret it!!
customer_reviews.author: EdNorton2

customer_reviews.title: Uoutstanding condition
customer_reviews.text: The Logitech Revue Companion Box with Google TV and Keyboard Controller was in better condition then expected for being a use item. The unit work as good as the first one I purchase at regular price. I read the review that this company received from past customers, so I decided to go with them, not only for the good review but their price for the Logitech Revue Companion Box was the lowest. I highly commend this company to anyone and in the near future I will purchase 2 additional Logitech Revue Companion Box from this company. .
customer_reviews.author: Cesar J. Vado

customer_reviews.title: Huge disapointment
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to help the visiting in-laws for easy internet and TV access. Setup was relatively painless. However we soon began having multiple flash errors on websites. The logitech support forums suggested rebooting and several other potential fixes. Nothing seemed to work. The unit fell into only occasional use(due to the hassle factor). Recently we've been having hdmi signal problems while watching satellite TV. The hi-def channels would have sound problems until we left the current channel and then returned. On a whim I disconnected the Revue. Suddenly, no more video problems. I swear that I love Logitechs products but I'm sorry I ever let this thing come into my house.
customer_reviews.author: E. Beck

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased this item and I must say that I absolutely love it! Was previously going to purchase a laptop or tablet to view streaming videos in my livingroom rather than my computer room but when you're watching movies with other people, more than one person trying to view a small tablet or laptop screen was just not feasible. Only problem I ran into was that I was not able to scroll up and down or left to right on web pages but finally discovered that you need to use the "page up" "page down" buttons on the keyboard or increase/decrease screen image to do this. All in all, I am certainly pleased with this.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. S

customer_reviews.title: Lots of potential
customer_reviews.text: For the current price everybody should have one. It plays Netflix on my TV and allows for convienent internet surfing. Also I can view all my pictures on my desktop via the local network on my TV. The speed is acceptable. My only big con is that it doesn't play Windows Media Video files over my network. One could convert everything to MP4s to make it accessible but it would take too long for 100's of family videos. I hope that the next update will introduce more codecs or that the opening to the android market place will allow some developers to come up with an appropriate application. Lets hope the best. :-)
customer_reviews.author: J S

customer_reviews.title: Almost fantastic...depends on what your needs are
customer_reviews.text: I'm located in Canada and ordered the Revue despite the limited functionality here. I was looking primarily for a media player/sharing device to stream files from my PC. Netflix, Pandora, and more do not work here, but the basic functionality of the device still does. To those in the States, this device is just short of amazing at $99. In Canada, it's still excellent if you're looking for streaming/sharing and/or browsing. It's also solid as a rock, very intuitive, and if the Honeycomb update ever comes out, it will be an amazing device.
customer_reviews.author: calbff

customer_reviews.title: Could be a better product.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the product is very good. It turns a regular tv into a smart tv by connecting to the internet and accessing different kinds of apps like netflix, amazone prime, google chrome, google tv, etc. However, I feel the unit itself needs an extra ethernet port. It would be nice to have that when I need to use both my pc and the logitech revue box at the same time. I also feel that the box could use an on/off button on the box itself. Just for energy conservation purposes. Well, maybe logitech will come out with these features next year.
customer_reviews.author: Pusheen

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 Roku players and returned all of them because they just did not work. We set up Google TV today. There were a few minor kinks that we have been able to work through. I highly recommend Google TV if you like to watch Netflix, use Amazon Prime, listen to Pandora, or watch one of the many other available channels. We are very happy with this purchase!! The price was very reasonable. When I first looked at Google TV the price was 3 times more than it is now. For $99 I feel like we got a bargain!
customer_reviews.author: RWK

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Revue so I could watch Netflix and get my email. The Revue does that wonderfully and more then I could have hoped for. I was turned on to Pandora with a yearly subscription of $32 includes listening with no commercials and many genera to choose from(Pandora is free with commercials). Just talked to Logitech support and was told that within a few weeks Logitech will have a new update for the Revue with lots of upgrades and new stuff. Love the keyboard as well and the tutorial that comes on the device. I payed $98 so again I am very pleased with my purchase. bought it Sept 2011
customer_reviews.author: W. Russell

customer_reviews.title: Change the way I watch TV
customer_reviews.text: This is simply the best companion with direct tv...Watch live events in the picture in picture, while talking about it online with other fans on facebook.. It is very smooth and slick.. Just make sure you reboot it from time to time to keep it smooth running.. It is a must have when planning to watch sports. Keep track with all the games and times they come on because it can be linked to your direct tv guide..I tell you it does it with no problem at all.. Set up is a breeze and it takes the place of a home computer to browse the internet. It is perfect and for the price, you can't go wrong....
customer_reviews.author: Lionel Leake

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: The Logitech Revue is a awesome addition in the fight to cut cable. Using the google play store can make the revue an incredible entertainment device! The only downside is that the android operating system needs to move forward so they can stream everything from the web. Many movie sites use certain web players and the revue is just not up to date on these (at this current time) My daughter uses the revue to complete homework and online projects. It makes your TV a extra computer! Highly, highly recommended! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Curt

customer_reviews.title: A great netflix appliance among other things
customer_reviews.text: The potential is there for more, but we use our Google TV a lot for Netflix, DLNA streaming, and youtube. I've played around with other features, but we only have OTA TV so I haven't tried out the set top box functionality. The keyboard is excellent and it was well worth the discounted price for the media playing aspects. The prospect of Apps since the last update just sweetens the deal. I'm still hoping they improve Google TV as I can see the potential, but as is I've been really happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven J. Sprigler

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Revue
customer_reviews.text: The product itself was fairly easy to setup and get working and does have a lot of functionality. There are some drawbacks that I have found thus far, you can not use Hulu at this time, there is no closed captioning ability for video media and the text size can not be increased on a lot of the media viewed on the internet. The drawbacks are on functions of the product and not slams on the actual box and keyboard itself. For the price I view this a good buy to enable getting the internet to my big screen TV and hope for improvements on functions in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: JPL

customer_reviews.title: Not for all TV brands
customer_reviews.text: Very convinient full size keyboard. Makes browsing a breeze. Be aware that this device does not work to its full potential on certain TV brands. You may want to check list of "compatible" TV brands (sony, samsung, vizio.... I think it is just 7 brands). If you have store brands like DYnex, Insignia or some "generic" brands, this will not work to full potential. I was unable to stream Netflix on one of my Best Buy brands TV. Had to return it
customer_reviews.author: PrincesseDi

customer_reviews.title: Includes Chrome Browser which Roku Box does not.  Includes Netflix and YouTube apps as well.  Perfect Surfing tool with keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Easiest and cheapest Surfing tool out there for an HDMI TV. The Keyboard is AAA Logitech quality. Unit comes with Netflix and YouTube apps along with Chrome browser from YouTube. As long as Google still supports this, it will be a great unit. I bought it used because it is no longer manufactured. I bought it as gifts. I cannot believe that Roku still does not provide a Chrome equivalent browser for Internet Surfing!
customer_reviews.author: BostonBidder

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and use, but did not last long
customer_reviews.text: A buddy of mine who is also a techie recommended this; at the time, it was $100. Worth the price for the keyboard alone. Worked like a champ for watching Netflix, doing a few marathons introducing my nephews to the great television series "24". Jack Bauer Power Hour. Two months later, my wife tells me the TV is not working. After debugging the cable/AVR/PS3/TiVO/TV setup, turns out the box somehow lost its mind and stopped working. It's now sitting in a box in the basement, maybe one day I'll hook it up to see what's wrong with it. But the keyboard is really sweet.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Rosenblum

customer_reviews.title: Never purchase this item
customer_reviews.text: Never bought this item. I don’t why it’s showing on my purchases for review, 🙄kind of weird
customer_reviews.author: Marta Muiz

customer_reviews.title: Still Going Strong
customer_reviews.text: Didn't realize til now that I had not reviewed this when I got it in 2011. I know it is not officially supported, but I still get updates and use it without any problems almost every day. My sister has a Roku and it drives me nuts when I am house sitting because it is so much harder to use. Love having the keyboard to make it all so easy to find what I want on Netflix.
customer_reviews.author: Luan K. Railsback

customer_reviews.title: Good product...but only useful within US ... for now
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product in the hope that even though I won't be able to use google TV (being outside US) it would still accept my STB and register it so that I can use at least my TV and STB with the controller. The fact remains that it wouldn't let you register your STB without a valid US ZIP code!!! So you still have to use the remote for your STB... Otherwise the product is great and installation was a breeze. The player is working great and internet is working OK. It's great to have a full keyboard controller. So far so good for the first 10 hours with this device...
customer_reviews.author: Saeed Malik

customer_reviews.title: With a continuing emphasis on expansion...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item. We have a Netflix account, and it works great (even though we want to dump Netflix sometime in the sorta-near future). I have not encountered anything that is bothersome about the interface yet, and there is an update being pushed out sometime soon, so I won't comment on that. The picture quality is very good. My only thing is that I want to see Hulu content on there. Then I'd give it 5 stars. The continuing addition of content will keep this product improving.
customer_reviews.author: S.B. Powell

customer_reviews.author: J. S. Harvey

customer_reviews.title: OK for YouTube, but Flash crashes constantly
customer_reviews.text: Title of the review says it all, I bought it to watch a certain website that broadcasts video shows, and I can't because the Flash plugin constantly crashes. If all you want to do is watch YouTube or Netflix (which I can do on my TV without the Google box, but the keyboard does make searching less frustrating) then you're ok. OK device, but not perfect. SInce I can't get a full refund now, I will give it to one of my kids, but I've ordered a Roku.
customer_reviews.author: Hill

customer_reviews.title: logitech customer service is scary
customer_reviews.text: i'm with my logitech, i've bought this revue for family use but after all, it had converted for personal use because its 20% intuitive form family members and its too laggy, his android market its horrible and only has about 30 apps that works fine on revue, most developers arent interested on google revue and 40% of apps in android market works on revue but developers didnt know that so app is locked for download and youll have to find tho apks on external webs
customer_reviews.author: Mike Sora

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I really love this product. My only complaint isn't even with the product, hence the 5 star rating. I am not a big fan of the media player software that you can download so you can stream video files from your computer. Maybe it is solely due to my computer running Vista, but sometimes the software doesn't load correctly. However, the Revue itself is great to surf the web, search for programming, and stream videos.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Greene

customer_reviews.title: Please keep making these Logitech!
customer_reviews.text: Great box, works very well and easy to set up. Wifi performance very good. I would buy anotherone but no longer made! Also works very well with Netflix in Australia, lipsync is perfect and no motion jerking, unlike cheap Chinese boxes I tried before finding this. Keyboard is great too.
customer_reviews.author: MyfordMan

customer_reviews.title: A worthy deal. Works just fine
customer_reviews.text: I never thought of it as an option as I was just looking for any smartTV box like roku or sonystreamingplayer. I saw that the price of this product was brought down to $100 recently and thought its worth a try. Arrived just in time, but it was not packaged in the logitech box. Not really sure why it was that way though. Packing was just perfect (just that it wasn't Logitech Box!!) (And the product wasn't refurbished either!!) It's been just a day and I am already enjoying it!! Especially because of the fact that it costed me just 113 bucks!! Good going for now. Will update the review as and when I keep using it!!
customer_reviews.author: Naveen

customer_reviews.title: Great Unit - Buy the Sony for Better Support
customer_reviews.text: Google TV is a good product. Some streaming media providers, like Fox intentionally block google TV from playing their shows on the unit. The amazon video, netflix, and hbo apps work seamlessly. I would buy google TV again, but I would buy it from Sony. Sony pushes out the new OS updates weeks or months ahead of Logitech and their help and support pages are better than what Logitech offers for the same product.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Martin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, low-power, low/no-maintenace, always on portal to the Internet
customer_reviews.text: I believe this is the best $100 I've ever spent! I've always wanted a LOW POWER, LOW-MAINTENANCE, quiet, stable, always-on web browser for the TV, and this fits the bill perfectly. After playing with it for a week or so, I have to say, I'm very impressed, and it should get even better soon with their late summer/early fall software update. Way to go Google and Logitech, and thank you for such an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: nishiko

customer_reviews.title: Was good, with Honeycomb it's terrible
customer_reviews.text: While this was a great device when it was released, since the Revue was updated to Honeycomb, this is a total PoS. Web browser - crash Flash - crash Amazon VOD - crash and that is if it is even responsive in the first place. At the moment, I am power cycling this box every week just so it does something. I have sent many reports to customer service, so they are aware of the issue, but do little or nothing to fix it. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: PAS

customer_reviews.title: Seemed like it would be great to use...bad impulse buy
customer_reviews.text: The device itself works fine, but to be honest I have never once had a legitimate use for it...with the easy of internet on my smart phone/laptop - I just never had the need to change my TV input, and use this device. It seemed like a cool thought and a neat purchase at the time. I bought this on impulse as I am a techno geek (my mistake), but now it just sits in the closet as I decided to give its HDMI input on my TV to another device.
customer_reviews.author: cldsk

customer_reviews.title: Good..
customer_reviews.text: Logitech Revue is easy to install, Android S.O is very stable with good performance with Android Market you can download and install apps. You can browse any website. The internal Media Player can't run somes video files formats like asf,flv,vod and some mpgs. If you are outside of USA you cant play Netflix,Pandora and Amazon Instant Video because need and USA IP but searching you cant find the solution ... I got it! Is an excelent product , I'm waiting for a new features upgrade !!!
customer_reviews.author: Luis Villalobos

customer_reviews.title: This is the worst purchase I have ever encountered in my life
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst purchase I have ever encountered in my life. So, let me tell you about this item.... Non of the apps work except the weather app and thats about it. They all crash. To be fair the netflix app does work but this item is garbage. I am a super positive person and still give okay reviews on decent products but I am so, so, so, so, mad at this it's not worth you're time. Trust me....buy it and see for yourself. Worse then direct tv going out in a storm Horrible!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brent B.

customer_reviews.title: No support
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these over a year ago but Logitech stopped supporting it. Surprised to see it still being sold. Haven't used it for a while until I started to watch youtube on it the other day. Works ok for that. Don't know if there is anything better out there these days. I'd look around and see if there is before I'd buy this one again. At least is still works and I have had some fun on youtube.
customer_reviews.author: bret4

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Typing this from the revue itself! I love it. I used to use a Webtv and MSNTV. This is better. It works as expected. I love the new update which now has Android apps and things. I love the apps. You can even side-load apps! It does need more space though. But it has enought space for up to 200 apps. Netflix works abit clunky. It either works or not at all. Pandora always works. Twitter is basic but works. There is Hootsuite even and Twitdroyd. I even got Yahoo Messenger and Amazon app store to work! It even works with Tivo premiere! Great for old MSNTV users! Chrome works as well as it does on a computer.
customer_reviews.author: Trinette Rani Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Returned it because I read on Amazon revues that neither Google nor Logitech were going to update its software
customer_reviews.text: After I got this I read the most recent reviews on Amazon about this device, and was upset to see multiple people advising that one not buy this because its software will not be updated by either Google or Logitech. So I never even set it up, and plan to return it in a day or two once I get some spare time to drop it off at UPS. I loved the way it looked. I really liked its little keyboard. Logitech should sell something that small as a wireless keyboard for computers.
customer_reviews.author: Edward W. Porter

customer_reviews.title: Great product (but won't work with a paid tv 'box')
customer_reviews.text: Used this at a friend's home and fell in love with it. Promptly ordered one for a gift but missed some important info -- this won't work without a set top box of some sort (paid tv/cable/satelite/x-box). Dang! SO disappointed; it went back today. This version with the larger keyboard is so much easier to use than this year's model (controller is the size of a smart phone)!
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Awesome UI for web on TV
customer_reviews.text: I'm in Australia, bought this product and got it the following week. The product is awesome for Web Interface for TV. Works with ABC Iview and BBC Iplayer really well. (You have to use a VPN or dns unblock service). Keyboard is really handy and interfaced perfectly with my AV receiver (Pioneer LC-71SX and old Panansonic 50" Plasma). Able to watch most divx/xvid/mkv content.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: Refurb was definitely still broken
customer_reviews.text: Intermittently, this product would show distortion lines at the top and bottom of the television. If I reset the unit, it would go back to normal again. It became such a nuisance that I stopped using the product and now it collects dust. The description was also misleading in that it made it sound like it had a sort of DVR capability built into the product, the only reason I bought it. Unfortunately, all it does is organize existing DVR saved recordings, which is hardly useful.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Hoerner

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: I love my google tv! Now that it has been updated to 2.3, I love it! I use netflix all the time, and youtube as well. I set it up with my comcast box and it was easy! The apps are great, and it works flawlessly. It can be slow at times, but that is rare. If you want a google tv, but don't want to spend a lot of money on a sony box, or tv, buy this! You will be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: AJ Pauline

customer_reviews.title: Great when it first came out, five star rating and then...
customer_reviews.text: When I first bought the revue, I was very pleased with what I could do. But as time went on and Logitech pulled their support from the revue, and you could not longer update the Google TV software it become more of a nuisance than an asset. I gave it away this year and bought a Chromebox for my TV.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Vickers

customer_reviews.title: not great, poor performance, locks up.
customer_reviews.text: It locks up, wifi reception is weak compared to other components in the same area. Netflix on this device randomly does not work, though device is now wired, we end up using the bluray player over wifi. Overall I would not recommend it. I've had it for a year or so now and will probably figure out some minimalist PC to use instead. Pretty disappointing overall.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all but could be better.
customer_reviews.text: Overall I'm pleased with the Logitech Revue, what it does it does very well, especially for the price of $100. The PIP is nice, renders web pages better than my smartphone, smooth interface, etc. Setup was easy, no flaws in that area at all. Cons, no app store. You are stuck with the apps that are pre-loaded on it. Maybe when they push out Honeycomb for the Revue this will change.
customer_reviews.author: Mattimus85

customer_reviews.title: don't use it any more after android update
customer_reviews.text: It was fine at first. Then after the software was updated with honeycomb, it was less usable. I would have to unplug it to reboot it often because it'd be stuck. So I'm no longer using this. The main reason I bought this was to be able to use a keyboard to search for things on youtube or netflix without having to press one letter at a time (like with a PS3 or Wii or Roku).
customer_reviews.author: Techie2000

customer_reviews.title: GoogTV = Love
customer_reviews.text: Got this at the low price with latest google O.S. and it is fantastic... Gave it 4 stars because touchpad cursor does not respond to "taps" and the back arrow is too close to the left click mouse button. Programming is fabulous though. Youtube is wonderful. Looking forward to next iteration of google TV hardware... c'mon guys, hurry it up! I'll buy it.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Logitech has discontinued production and support
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product in good faith, but no one ever told me it was being discontinued because of all the problems Logitech had with Google TV and this product. As it stands today, I have to do a factory reset every 2 days to get any use out of this product. It comes with over 500 Mb of disk space, but after downloading one app (10.8 Mb) suddenly I have no space available to download more apps or to use the apps which came preinstalled. And you can't uninstall the preinstalled apps to make room for ones you might actually use. Do yourself a favor. Don't buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Raodyn

customer_reviews.title: At $99 this is an AWESOME Deal
customer_reviews.text: This is an AWESOME deal at $99.00. Basically turns your TV into an internet surfing device. Google Chrome is on there and I use it more there than on any other computer at home. Netflix works great, Pandora and Internet video podcast queueing. I subscribe to a number of video podcasts and it is great to watch them in HD right from the device. I heard lots of complaints about hooking it up and getting started, but it was easier than my last Bluray player.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Johnstone

customer_reviews.title: The trackpad is in the corner implying you use it ...
customer_reviews.text: The trackpad is in the corner implying you use it with one hand, but the buttons are directly below the trackpad making a challenge to click and move at the same time. The buttons should have been on the left for your other hand. Navigating is also much slower than a normal PC browser.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Bigham

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Received on 12/15, the day of the first Google software update. I'm very happy with this product. The setup was a very, very simple 12-step process. The Revue recognized my DirecTV box, my Mitsubishi TV and even, surprisingly, my Yamaha Sound Bar, which I input as my "AV Receiver". Sweet! My main purpose for buying this was because of a certain adult cable channel that cost $15.99/month + taxes on DirecTV and only $7.99/month for internet access to the same programming from the cable channel's website. The DirecTV channel is in standard definition and the internet site contains HD. A win-win for me.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Good idea that is not being allowed to work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a laptop computer I have been using to watch tv online with. I like the small size and it works good. The keyboard is small for my fat hands and light. The idea is great but it seems like every other website I go to blocks Google TV. They say they are working on it but some websites have been saying that for years. If Google TV was not being blocked this would be a great device. I may use it for AmaZon's video service and the built in web browser is good. I'm sorry to say I cant get rid of my laptop just yet.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G. Leffler

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. I just bought two of them, one for my living room and the other one for my bedroom. It controls perfectly my LG Tv, my Directv HR22 set top box and my Sony Receiver. I am so happy with it. This product will get better after the major system update scheduled for the end of summer wich will introduce android honeycomb and android market. The only thing I don't like is that the google chrome browser does not allow to install extensions.
customer_reviews.author: Pakex

customer_reviews.title: Spot On!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this device as a gift to someone, someone who is not technology savvy and he loves Logitech Google TV. The product does exactly what the advertisement claims. We can surf the net through the tv. We have a 70 inch tv ad comcast tv and we had to upgrade to HD (only the tv that has the google tv box.
customer_reviews.author: Shad in DC

customer_reviews.title: good stuff
customer_reviews.text: I like this because I am able to log onto websites as well as worksites. The keyboard allows a better experience for me to get things done online, check my gmail, send emails, etc. The other internet TV options make you use a remote congtrol to navigate through the alphabet, etc. This is an oldie but a goodie.
customer_reviews.author: Alma del Sol

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Revue
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 2 months ago for $129.99 and for the price is a good value. It adds browser functionality to my TV, but I was using it mainly for playing my movie downloads that are on my computers. I ran into various problems playing certain file types, usually large files like MKV +.dts files, so I actually bought a Popcorn Hour C-300 which is more of a prosumer product. More expensive, but no problems since.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth A. Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Great product, just not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: While for the money ($99) it truly is a great product. Easy to use and very versatile. Hooks easily into my media server allowing me to stream already owned digital content. Browsing the internet and watching content is very polished. Downsides: No Android Market (yet), so no addable applications. Doesn't stream all my media server content.
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great reception (when other devices did not do so well in this spot). Works flawlessly. Easy setup. Easy to use. Nice size keyboard not to big or small. all the features I wanted. Only negative is the lack of instructions for advanced use. At a $100 this device is priced right on target. It's been a year still working. Nice product.
customer_reviews.author: MASH

customer_reviews.title: DISAPPOINTING.....
customer_reviews.text: REVUE COMPANION BOX DOESN'T SUPPORT YOU TUBE PLAYER & FAILS TO UPDATE TO CURRENT PLAYER WHICH I FOUND DISAPPOINTING....IT ALSO IS RUNNING ON A NON SUPPORTED CHROME BROWSER THAT DOESN'T UP DATE TO A CURRENT VERSION....IF IT HAD CURRENT SOFTWARE IT WOULD BE 5 STAR..........11/30/15....
customer_reviews.author: Lee Fairman

customer_reviews.title: CONSTANTLY DROPS WIFI CONNECTION
customer_reviews.text: Overall the concept of this product is good, but the wifi receiver is terrible. I have a very fast internet connection and a decent router, but this device keeps dropping the connection when I watch Netflix. I have to constantly reboot the device. I called Logitech customer service twice and their advice did not solve the problem--frustrating!!! This is annoying because this is the main reason for the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: CGUZMAN

customer_reviews.title: Lazy man's couch potato device.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent alternative to other similar devices as it features allowing full access to anything on the internet using Google search. The keyboard is the best feature of this product as you type as on a computer while accessing your input on a larges screen HDTV.
customer_reviews.author: Trader One

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I have been thinking about getting this box for a while but the price was too much, so when they dropped it to $99 I jumped on it. Have a Roku box as well and will probably move that away from the "main' tv. Love how it gives you access to the net as well as Netflix, really feels like it ties everything together. Probably will buy some more of these soon.
customer_reviews.author: Eric D.

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid product. So many uses and more to come
customer_reviews.text: This product does everything I was expecting and more. Initially I just wanted a quick and easy way to integrate the Internet with my TV and stream content. With several children in college I also purchased the HD video camera and it works flawlessly. Called support to ask a few questions and actually got an English speaking support person who knew and used the product. He told me that first quarter 2011 a fuller set of Android apps would become available along with Java support in the Chrome browser.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Very good browsing experience. Lack apps
customer_reviews.text: Installation :- very easy and accurate Remote :- Easy to operate. There are few short cuts for lot of stuff but that requires learning curve. Still don't know if I can control my TV the way I control it through my other logitech remote. Browsing :- It is awesome. there is no flash restriction. Over all for $99 it is awesome. And I just got an email that they will be providing lot of software updates so it will be even more cool. Till date I just loved this product. Also Logitech support is just awesome.
customer_reviews.author: N. Munhet

customer_reviews.title: Still the best
customer_reviews.text: Its a bit quirky, can be a crash beast at times but if you want something to bring you content from the net and your local content, its still the best. I cannot imagine searching through all of my local content using a TV like remote, the keyboard is a must.
customer_reviews.author: Steve_Mays

customer_reviews.title: Revue's Review
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Nice Product, Works well as desired, website surfing on TV in living room is almost as normal as surfing on PC. Cons: Having very limited internal memory, no power off option/switch on the device, temporarily internet connection drop (when not in use), having android 3.1 but market place is very limited in terms of number of apps available for this product, not supported the Skype which is more common free video call standard now, to install applications consecutively need to power off system as many times as many application we want to install. Verdict: at 99 USD, this product worth to buy, easy in use and overall serve it's intended purpose well
customer_reviews.author: kumar

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. In fact, I bought a second unit for another TV. It's so easy to set up and use. I haven't explored all the features. I know it can do much more than the simple internet, NETFLIX, YouTube, Pandora, things I use it for. I like the large wireless keyboard, too. I would definitely recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Was cool until the upgrade - now all I see is "Aw snap" error
customer_reviews.text: This was a nice little add on to my TV. It was nice to be able to read emails and do minor browsing while watching the news. The upgrade however has made the box unusable and Logitech support for the issues has been lackluster to says the least. Google TV is cool, just avoid Logitech - they just went back on my "Do Not Buy" list.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wheelock

customer_reviews.title: Great fun but needs refinement
customer_reviews.text: Price reduction makes this worth the venture. The device still has serious constraints (notably content being blocked by hulu and certain major networks) and needs to seriously expand its overall functionality but it works as advertised and is a lot of fun in its current form. My hope is that the promised extension of available apps matched with broader content access will make this even more valuable. Both Google and Logitech should stay the course with this path in my opinion although I'm not sure they will.
customer_reviews.author: deanofgview

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This product does a lot of cool things. There is a full use chrome browser with flash enabled which is key for streaming online. The apps are still quite limited which holds back this product. Also, it crashes about once a week and requires a reboot. But overall, i'm happy with the flexibility it provides me and I'm glad I own it.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Love my Google TV
customer_reviews.text: What a command center. My new Logitech Revue Companion Box with Google TB and Keyboard Controller combined with my 70" Sharp LCD has put me into a whole new world of entertainment, education, and enjoyment. Finally, from one command center I can go anywhere in the known universe and explore, retrieve, and create. And with the continuous updates it keeps getting better and better. I highly recommend that you get one for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Work and I feel I got my moneys worth
customer_reviews.text: If your tv is not smart then this would be a stupid buy for smart tv's are cheap as this box. But i have used it for good long while and it works with a few bugs and the keyboard is with out doubt better then the crappy remote smart tvs gives you to type with.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie W. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Ignore the negative reviews. Best $100 you will spend.
customer_reviews.text: Since Logitech had a bad quarter(s), it dropped the prices of Revue to $100...so I figured, what the heck and bought it. (Thank your Amazon Prime for super fast delivery.) The product is truly awesome. It's Google TV plus the best universal remote you ever had. It does NOT make any loud fan noises as included in some reviews here and the overlay is not going to cause burn-in on your plasma (unless may you have an old generation plasma and you leave it on a widget/overlay screen way too long). buy this project and enjoy. My set up: My Revue is connected via wireless, through AT&T Uverse.
customer_reviews.author: kpaynter

customer_reviews.title: great machine
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great, sure it has some shortcomings but they are overshadowed by all that it does. I have bought three of them so far and am about to buy another. I hope they do eventually upgrade the firmware to allow it to access the Android Market but if it never happens for under a hundred bucks it is still worth it.
customer_reviews.author: APS

customer_reviews.title: Simple internet playback device running Android
customer_reviews.text: If you're used to Android phones and tablets, the interface is familiar and easy to use. We bought the device to get internet streaming movies on our TV. It works great for Netflix, Amazon Prime movies, and Youtube. We've also tried a few other Android apps without problems. Pros: Big remote keyboard with touch pad. Small footprint. Works perfectly for video playback. Cons: No power/reset button. Needs to be rebooted by unplugging power. Fan is quiet, but can still be heard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: do not buy in 2013
customer_reviews.text: first of all this device goes for 99usd elsewhere. secondly it is too old as for 2013. the processor is pretty slow. I own a device since 2 years, it has served me well, but don't buy it anymore especially since logitech has discontinued it
customer_reviews.author: Lukas

customer_reviews.title: Wait for the next gen
customer_reviews.text: This seemed like a great way to extend our tv viewing into a room without cable. The box is easy to set up and seems like it would work in theory but we encountered so many bugs that we can rarely watch things for more than a couple of minutes. Netflix has been the only thing we can watch reliably and you can get a better deal with a streaming DVD player. Content is extremely limited and it doesn't stream from the web well on non-google content. The remote is cumbersome and hard to view without full lighting (not great when watching a movie for example). In retrospect I would wait until the next generation product!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product Review
customer_reviews.text: Great quality for the price. It is Uverse unfriendly but th This is just my opinion and I'm writing this because in order to leave a review I must have a certain amount of words in my review. Really!!! AYFKM. Jusy Saying.e rest of the feature are cool.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Google tv and logitech- a match made in heaven!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, easy to use and easy to add apps. I love the keyboard! I also downloaded the app for my phone so i can control my whole entertainment system with my phone. How cool is that!? My only gripe is that Hulu is not available and i've tried all the backdoor loophole type crap to try and get it but nothing has worked so far. Since i'm a Netflix fan it doesn't bother me too much. What does bother me is the fact that i can't get angry birds apps. That why i gave it four stars instead of five. Great product for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: juice head

customer_reviews.title: Needs updated
customer_reviews.text: Love the functionality it gives me. The logitech mediaplayer leaves too much to be desired though, only plays about 50% of my avi's. Other than that no complaints, once it is updated then this will be the best value for web browsing, checking email, facebook, and twitter... among other things
customer_reviews.author: Nick Mayer

customer_reviews.title: I really like it, has huge potential
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for $99.00 can't beat that price. had to see how it worked. It has many nice features. I'm waiting to get the new Android software update that will open it up to running applications. I currently read email, surf the web. the web browser on it is actually better than many of the other boxes similar to this ( boxee box) I have both. Boxee has a way better interface for your movies stored local on a drive. I am hoping that they update will fix that on the google tv box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Bad OS
customer_reviews.text: the android OS for this product not complete comparing with Samsung tablet also the Google play store have very less apps comparing to tablet and the mobile . i test it with many movies is not playing the MP4, MKV, ...etc. windows and Mac is better.
customer_reviews.author: Ghareed I. Joharji

customer_reviews.title: Nice additio but...
customer_reviews.text: Almost the ideal addition but lacks some of the functions of a web site (such as minimizing) . Book marking is not easy and not all the clicks respond in what you may think is intuitive' IE some left clicks only respond in certain fields.
customer_reviews.author: Chaz

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have much expectation, so I was pleasantly surprised by its ease of use. It doesn't have much in terms of content and applications, but I was looking mainly for Netflix, Youtube, and Chrome Browser (wished it functioned like Chrome on a computer though).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for the price. I can watch You tube and chrome works great and the key board is fantastic. It only needs an external mouse port on the keyboard. I just have to reboot it sometimes and that may be something in the set up..
customer_reviews.author: David Wray

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyable
customer_reviews.text: I'm older and so am out of the loop when it comes to keeping up the latest trends...but reading about this intrigued me and I decided to splurge on a whim. I'm pleasantly surprised with theThe full keyboard is great; I enjoy the ability to have PIP (at least it resembles that even though it's really not - my only concern is the size of the remote/keyboard - I had to make extra room on my end table; gone went the humidor - alas, it's time to quit anyway. Fun product, easy to install, quick response time, small learning curve - attractive (once room is made on one's end table)...recommend!
customer_reviews.author: J. Blackwood

customer_reviews.title: Would have been neat...
customer_reviews.text: This unit started out extremely cool. Browse the internet on a super size TV, plain and simple. Only problem is...when left idle for a day or two, the unit goes blank. A grey screen takes over your normal TV functions considering the Revue becomes your master controller once hooked up...the only way I could reset the Revue was to unplug it and plug it back in, wait for it to do it lengthy startup jingle then start using it again. I had to do this basically everyday. There is no power button or reset button on the unit. Would have been cool had it not done that, I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: xjgxatx

customer_reviews.title: No real use for this thing, parents wanted me ...
customer_reviews.text: No real use for this thing, parents wanted me to buy it for them, it's the same as connecting your laptop/other except you have a keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Blerim

customer_reviews.title: Setup Authentication Failure
customer_reviews.text: Hi, Please be aware because of [...] There is something wrong with some of the models, so You will hang on setup step 7 of 11 with error during accepting license terms (Authentication failure), in my case reset didnt help so I am returning my model to Amazon with refund option, imho this is really a christmas joke: I have unpacked the gift try to setup it up, and then .... disappointment... in front of the whole family.... I wouldnt recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: lukaszj

customer_reviews.title: Does what is advertised but not too much else.
customer_reviews.text: While the SDK for this device doesn't come out until next year, the applications are not as bountiful as they could be. This box does what it is supposed to do. If you are looking for a way to pipe IR commands through it, that is a no-go as of yet. You'll need an IR extender kit if you are planning on hiding any equipment other than a TV, STB, or AVR as those are the only things this box can control. All-in all, I think it is a great idea and may become something extraordinary in the future. It just doesn't "do-it-all" as I hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Revue Rocks!!!!
customer_reviews.text: If you have a smart tv, then the logitech revue will be its new best friend. It is amazing. You can watch movies, research for shows, see whats playing now and in the future, listen to music and more. Plus it works with netflix and my phone. So awesome~!!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca D. Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product for last few hours and am delighted with its performance and resolution. Setup was a breeze, very organized progressive steps. The device stays on all the time and it keeps internet connection and cable live; when I turn on tv, I see it instantly. Keyboard is very easy and comfortable to use(could be smaller in size), don't have to point it towards the device - I use it from 15 feet away, from my breakfast bar and it works out fine. My wife is extremely happy to have it, she doesn't have to connect her laptop to tv anymore for watching her programs. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer
